info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 1:37AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McDowell, west central Alexander, Caldwell, southeastern Avery and northwestern Burke Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 137 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Blowing Rock, or 7 miles southwest of Darby, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Gamewell, Hudson, Cajah`s Mountain, Blowing Rock In Caldwell County, Cedar Rock, Table Rock, Linville Falls, B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather and Edgemont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for western North Carolina.
